radiofeed.podcasts.emails module¶

radiofeed.podcasts.emails.send_recommendations_email(user, min_podcasts=2, max_podcasts=3)¶

Sends email to user with a list of recommended podcasts based on their subscriptions and listening history.

Recommended podcasts are saved to the database, so the user is not recommended the same podcasts more than once.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – authenticated user

  • min_podcasts (int) – minimum number of podcasts: if less than this amount then no email is sent

  • max_podcasts (int) – maximum number of podcasts to include in email

Returns:

whether user has been sent recommendations email

Return type:

bool

radiofeed.podcasts.itunes module¶

class radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.Feed(rss: str, url: str, title: str = '', image: str = '', podcast: radiofeed.podcasts.models.Podcast | None = None)¶

url: str¶
radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.build_feeds_from_json(json_data)¶
radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.crawl()¶

Crawls iTunes podcast catalog and creates new Podcast instances from any new feeds found.

Crawling is restricted to small set of locations (US, UK etc).

Yields:

Feed – any new or existing feeds

radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.get_response(url, data=None)¶
radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.parse_feeds(json_data)¶

Adds any existing podcasts to result. Create any new podcasts if feed URL not found in database. Existing Podcast instances are attached as podcast to the Feed instance.

Parameters:

json_data (dict) – JSON payload returned from iTunes API

Yields:

Feed – any new or existing feeds

radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.parse_genre_urls(location)¶
radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.parse_podcast_id(url)¶
radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.parse_podcast_ids(url, location)¶

Parse iTunes podcast IDs from provided URL

radiofeed.podcasts.itunes.parse_urls(content)¶

search_term (str) – search term(s)

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

children¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class radiofeed.podcasts.models.PodcastQuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None, hints=None)¶

Bases: FastCountMixin, SearchMixin, QuerySet

scheduled()¶

Returns podcasts scheduled for update.

Scheduling algorithm:

  1. check once every n hours, where “n” is the number

    of days since the podcast was last updated (i.e. last pub date)

  2. if podcast was last updated within 24 hours, check once an hour.

  3. if podcast was last updated > 24 days, check every 24 hours.

  4. if podcast has not been checked yet (i.e. just added to database), check immediately.

Only active podcasts should be included.

Returns:

scheduled podcasts

Return type:

QuerySet

radiofeed.podcasts.recommender module¶

class radiofeed.podcasts.recommender.Recommender(language, num_matches)¶

Bases: object

Creates recommendations for given language, based around text content and common categories.

Parameters:

  • language (str) – two-character language code e.g. “en”

  • num_matches (int) – number of recommendations to create

build_matches_dict(podcasts, categories)¶
find_similarities(podcasts)¶

Given a queryset, will yield tuples of (id, (similar_1, similar_2, …)) based on text content.

  • categories (QuerySet) – category instances

recommendations_from_matches(matches)¶
radiofeed.podcasts.recommender.recommend(since=datetime.timedelta(days=90), num_matches=12)¶

Generates Recommendation instances based on podcast similarity, grouped by language.

Any existing recommendations are first deleted.

Parameters:

  • since (timedelta) – include podcasts last published since this period

  • num_matches (int) – total number of recommendations to create for each podcast
